question.title: I am developing springboot application using gradle and want to have both thin and fat jars with slight difference
question.body:
I want this application to be deployed on the server and running as well and I want it to be used as a dependency jar in another project. I want to exclude the resources folder only in the dependency jar(thin jar) and include it in an executable(fat) jar so that I can use it.

I tried using the code below in the build.gradle file. The gradle file excludes the resources folder from both thin and fat jars.

tasks.jar { processResources.exclude('*') }

I am using the below versions gradle 8.8, java 21 and spring-boot 3.3.3

Let me know what more I can add to Gradle to have this jars in place.

Thanks
